website_summaries.verdict: Sturdy fabric that allows the grow bag to stand up on its own making it easy to fill.
pros: A six-pack set that features sizes ranging from 3 to 10 gallons
Has tough handles on the fabric that will give you the ability to carry these bags easily
The fabric of the bags allows air to move through nicely, helping plants grow
Shape of bag has good balance
cons: No bags larger than the 10-gallon option

customer_reviews.title: Decent Pots
customer_reviews.text: Bought this six pack along with few other sizes for my greenhouse plants. I love the black to keep the soil warm and the fabric for drainage. These pots are great! The handles make them easy to carry and move, room enough for larger plants. This is the first season I'm using them, I plan on getting a few more years out of them before recycling. The water seeps out of these perfectly, no overwatering worries. The price is great and again, the color is just perfect for keeping the soil warm throughout the colder months.
customer_reviews.author: F. M. Emmett

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable grow bags
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 6 pack of the 10 gallon grow bags. They are well made and I am using them to grow some Okra, Egg plants and Zucchini. The volume is as stated.
customer_reviews.author: Nyer

customer_reviews.title: Lift evenly with care and caution. . .
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 6pk of 10gal garden bags to replace the garden boxes in my backyard. I’m very pleased with the size and look of the bags. They worked exactly as I anticipated them to and look great in my yard. Unfortunately the second time moving one of the bags one of the handles broke, now making it very difficult to adjust if needed. Hoping the company will remedy this with a replacement, very inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: BeeShortts

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What a Pleasant Surprise!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was rather hesitant to buy these grow bags because of some of the reviews I read. I wasn't quite sure what I'd get; however the box arrived today (just one day after ordering them) and I was thrilled with this product!!! These bags are nice and thick, seem to be great quality, and I love that they have handles so you can move them around easily. I am so happy with my purchase!!!! I would definitely buy these again! They are a terrific price, great quality, and exactly the size I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Cid

customer_reviews.title: Value for money, plants grow up healthy!
customer_reviews.text: These were probably the best decision. I have an apartment and didn't want big pot which would be a pain to store later. Also, the bigger ones are so heavy it a pain to move them. The handles on this fabric pot make it so easy to push it around. The plants grew up healthy as there was no water logging. I have three cucumber plants comfortably growing in this pot! As a plus point- I used one of the bags as grocery bag because it can hold heavy items well.
customer_reviews.author: Manisha

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service 2
customer_reviews.text: The bags are not as thick as other fabric pots I've used. I was thinking about returning them, but the company responded to my concern promptly. I have decided to give them a chance this summer. I will update my review. 2 things- 1. Great customer service 2. You do get 6 instead of the 5 other companies sell It isn't a Smart Pot, but it's cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: The guy

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised, cool alternative planter
customer_reviews.text: I hage never seen these before but thought I would give then a try since a larger plastic container is so dang expensive. I was pleasantly surprised of the sturdiness. I kind of expected it to be like those thin reusable shopping bags but more like 3x's the thickness of those. I have transplanted one plant to a fabric container so we will see how it does. I am looking forward to trying out starting my plants in them and trying to move them around so I can see how the handles hold up.
customer_reviews.author: amw828

customer_reviews.title: Great Growing Pot
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Phoenix area and decided to give felt pots a try. I tried the previous year to keep plants in plastic pots year round and struggled to keep them cool in the summer without over watering. This year I used these felt pots and the plants thrived through the summer and actually grew more than the ones that I planted in the ground. Now I'm using felt pots for all of my potted plants and have not been disappointed. I've only used these pots for one seasons now, but they have held up and I expect them to last for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Emerson

customer_reviews.title: One time use only..but great root growth..heathy plants
customer_reviews.text: Negative: I used these pots for the season with eggplant, tomatoes and peppers. Im really indifferent with the rating Im giving this product. I figured I would be able to use these more than once but they seemed to just break down easy and the handles started ripping after moving plants a few times. Positive: These pots are great for root and plant growth! Best root development I've had next to airpots at a much cheaper price. However, I can reuse my airpots. If you don't care about the one time use then get them. Maybe being in South Florida it takes more of beating from sun and weather..
customer_reviews.author: Sid The Kid

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised by the quality (10 gallon)
customer_reviews.text: I left these outside with plants all last summer and with just soil all winter and the pots are holding up great! I grew potatoes in them and they did splendidly. I use the handles to turn and move the pots short distances pretty frequently and none of the 5 have started to show any tearing yet. I did have a little algae growth in the bottom of one that sat near a rain gutter pipe, but it was only on the bottom so it didn't affect the plants at all. Overall very happy. Thinking about getting more.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyJ

customer_reviews.title: A gardeners Best friend
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these bags. We currently have potatoes, tomatoes, spinach, peppers, lettuce, and herbs growing in them. The kids love em, because they can keep up with these to see how their pants are growing. They enjoy their summer project of growing food, and watching them grow. Also you get no critters that tend to live under ground to eat or destroy your plants. Will get more for next year!
customer_reviews.author: Ingry

customer_reviews.title: BETTER AND BIGGER THAN I EXPECTED -- GOOD VALUE
customer_reviews.text: My little family likes to grow our own potatoes, and decided to try this product instead of putting them in a raised planted, where the potatoes often compromise the roots of other plants nearby. I was pleasantly surprised to find that these grow bags are larger than I pictured, and seem sturdier than I expected. I also like that they come with useful carrying handles, made of the same material as the bag, and that makes them easy to move around if needed. I feel I got more than I bargained for, so I'm extra happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mo H.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: They have started falling apart within a week of being outside - holes everywhere and handles falling off. Sad that I didn't learn this before the return window closed!!!
customer_reviews.author: JS22

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Surpassed my expectations. These grow bags are sturdy and well made and look like they will last for years. They hold plenty of soil and seem to maintain moisture better than hard plastic pots. Also, you get more bang for your buck with these... cost a third of what a standard ten gallon planter would cost. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ajoy8

customer_reviews.title: 2 months in and they work great
customer_reviews.text: I started to use them in May and by July the plants so much bigger than the ones I planted in the ground. At first I made sure that they got watered enough, but lately the rain we've had seems to be enough. Easy to move and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: ... these for about 8 or 9 months now with great results. They're filled with a mix of about ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for about 8 or 9 months now with great results. They're filled with a mix of about 70% Pete and 30% perlite, and weigh a fair about when wet, however, despite the age(8 or 9 months) and the weight, the handles manage to carry the loaded bags just fine. Durable, well-made, long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Go'bah Smithstem

customer_reviews.title: Love the quality
customer_reviews.text: Love that these are moveable. I've heard great things about these fabric pots in gardening so I bought these to plant some of my vegetables in instead of planting them in my inground garden.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Growing Strong
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product last spring for a small container garden I've started in a very tight space with limited sunlight. This spring I ordered more of a different size. Since I have limited sunlight hours, it's critical that I am able to easily move the plants to the sun. This product fits the bill. Hope to be able to add more sizes later this year and next. The bags are durable, heading into their second growing season after sitting outside during a New England winter. I was able to grow tomatoes and compact watermelon in the 10 gallon bags. This year I'm planting cucumbers,
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Work as robust harvest baskets as well.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly well made of sturdy materials. I found they are a good size for harvest baskets, will haul compost and small tools as well as being a great size for planting. The fact that they fold flat and can store on a shelf is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: KatManning

customer_reviews.title: These are my go-to garden containers from now on
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using grow bags & I'm pleased to say that I love these bags so far. They're a thick fabric that is light in weight & seems very durable. The handles are sewn well. To my surprise, they made mixing all my soil amendments, a breeze! It was almost as if the bag were a large mixing bowl & my hands were the mixers. I've never had such ease when using rigid containers. I kept exclaiming how much I already love these bags! I will have to come back next year & revise my review, to add how well they worked &/or if they held up well enough to use again for another growing season
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great solution if you don’t want to store huge plastic plant containers
customer_reviews.text: Great solution if you don’t want to store huge plastic plant containers that take up valuable storage space in the shed! Of course if you fill these bags with an ample amount of soil or other medium it will get heavy. I bought two and so far so good. Plants are thriving and I’m glad I bought the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: sd

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money and fertilizer
customer_reviews.text: I used these this year for small space gardening of tomatoes, green peppers, and banana peppers. They don't hold water so that watering once a day is not enough in July and August. The material doesn't hold moisture or fertilizer so that the plants are constantly dry and starving for food. Definitely not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: dakota1gal

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant tomato pots!
customer_reviews.text: Great 10 gallon pots, perfect for my determinant tomato plants. I was able to get more deliciousness closer to me by using my patio space instead of the back forty garden. I will be buying more if you can keep them in stock as all my friends want them now too!
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Instant garden without heavy lifting!
customer_reviews.text: I love them! They’re way lighter than clay pots and the have HANDLES. I can move my potatoes and tomatoes and whatever else wherever and whenever I want to! 💪🏼 Very handy for fluctuating spring temps and ever- changing garden setup. It was so much simpler setting these up than any other container I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Mock

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to my garden
customer_reviews.text: I have potatoes, basil and lettuce growing in these right now. They are sturdy and a great addition to my garden. I like being able to move them around a bit as needed (more sun, less wind...). I have moved these when they were full of soil, with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: darxtar

customer_reviews.title: Great for growing potatoes.
customer_reviews.text: These were just about what I expected. Yhey are capacious enough for a good sized plant. I grow 5 seed potatoes in each. Since my garden structure isn't finished yet it is handy to have the bags movable so I can shift them around as needed. When it time to harvest I can just dump the bags out on a tarp and harvest one bag at a time--easier on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and easy to move.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my housekeeper. She helped me plant in mine and when we had to move them to get out of hail danger. She wanted some for herself and this is the order for her.
customer_reviews.author: u2hazlet

customer_reviews.title: Liked so much I got more!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this alternative to traditional plastic, ceramic, and terra cotta pots. Very versatile as we garden with dirt but also for our ponds. Easier to manage during potting or moving the plants. So much more lightweight. This is my new way to plant! Bravo.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nerius

customer_reviews.title: Grow Bag
customer_reviews.text: I used them this growing season and they work. The only thing is, when they are filled with soil, it takes two persons to lift one of those things. The cool thing about these growing bags, you can elevate them to prevent those critters from harvesting your crops before you do..
customer_reviews.author: Brunson

customer_reviews.title: Seem great so far, update will come at end of season.
customer_reviews.text: Just transplanted some pepper and tomatoes into these. Wider than they are deep, but still plenty deep. I fit two bell pepper plants in one, with six inches or so between them, which should be fine with pruning. Will come back at the end of the season to adjust my review.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great for my garden.
customer_reviews.text: I just recently knew about this product through youtube. Bought it here and tried the 10 gallon. Hahaha. Too big. But good for my vegetable garden. Able to move it around. Easy because it has handles. Color is great too. And for the price i will be switching this for my vegetable garden.
customer_reviews.author: Shielisse

customer_reviews.title: very handy
customer_reviews.text: Dug up some roses that I want to transplant to a new home. These have worked out well. The roses have done well in them and are almost healthier than when they were in the ground. Easy to carry - handles are attached. Makes the process of moving them much lighter than pots.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Shumway

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, doesn't hold water
customer_reviews.text: I love this product; however, you need to make sure that you are not putting it on your porch with wooden floor. It lose water really fast, and you need to water your plants in more frequent manner. Anyhow, I love this product sitting on my cement balcony!
customer_reviews.author: Bahareh S

customer_reviews.title: A bit flimsier than expected
customer_reviews.text: These are fairly nice and you get a lot for the price, but they weren't able to stand up to the weight we put in them and we got a bit of tearing at one of the handles. Otherwise they're decent, they'd be useful in a pinch for small jobs (maybe try lightweight annual flowers with shallow roots vs. a young tree, for example). Seller easy to work with - fast shipping, good seller.
customer_reviews.author: Ad n' Audie

customer_reviews.title: These grow bags works perfect for container gardening!
customer_reviews.text: These 10 gallon grow bags are perfect for container gardening. My vegetables are growing well beyond my expectation. I love that I can easily they hold move them to any desired location and even though they are designed to drain excess water they also retain moisture very well. Will definitely buy again. Don't know yet if they will hold up for several more use.
customer_reviews.author: menen

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and in good condition. I’ve packed with a mixture of garden soils and moved them across my yard into a sunny location. Bags had no problem with the load of dirt (even though the rains had weighed them down) and handles made that easier. I’m looking forward to getting several years use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working for me
customer_reviews.text: Using them for potatoes, broccoli, tomatoes too. Probably good to get some dfferent sizes as I only got one size.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These bags are a great product. They hold a lot of soil. They can be moved around easily so you can find the plant's happy place. I highly recommend them. I have only used them for this season, so I don't know how many seasons they will last. Overall I am happy with them
customer_reviews.author: D. Teklemariam

customer_reviews.title: great deal great quality
customer_reviews.text: Loving these pots so far! The handles are definitely keeping up with all the moving around they have been through. They are pretty thick material and even though they are black they are keeping cool enough to keep the plants happy!
customer_reviews.author: FreakShow

customer_reviews.title: Tomato plants very happy in their new fabric pots
customer_reviews.text: So far these fabric pots are holding up very well for my plants. I have a bunch of tomato plants in the 10 gallon pots and they seems to have responded nicely to it. They're not full grown yet and this is my first season using these type of pots, so I'll update this review once I've gone through a full growing cycle. My hope is that they'll hold up well enough for me to get a few years out of them.
customer_reviews.author: The Wayfarer

customer_reviews.title: perfect for growing patio plants
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I have planted tomatoes and peppers in them and grow on the porch. Planted early so I could bring in when the weather was to cold or a frost. Plan on growing these in the housing during winter. We shall see if it works.8
customer_reviews.author: sharon roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two packages of these. I received an incorrect order (size and number). I returned it today, and this evening, I received the correct order. The bags look great and the customer service was so good (beyond good) that I have ordered two more sets. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Super Convenient, A+ Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome. I transport my potted perennials and tropical plants into the basement under grow lights for winter. Some of the small trees are in large planters and very heavy. I transferred them into these fabric planters which made them much easier to move with the handles. They are very sturdy and can take A LOT of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I grew tomatoes in these last year. They worked great. I didn't try to move them around once I had plants in them, but I think it would have been easy enough with two people to take one side each. They let me expand my growing space onto the driveway next to my house instead of adding extra garden plots. I got lots of tomatoes off of these plants!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great if you struggle with an area in your yard that doesn’t get enough sun. I put these bags in the driveway where they would get a lot of sun and the tomatoes and peppers are doing very well. Easy to take care of and no weeds!! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: darrell

customer_reviews.title: Worderful surprise of quality
customer_reviews.text: I havent used them yet to plant my raised vegetable garden but on inspection the quality is way better than expected. I'm looking forward to using them as soon as the rain stops in my area
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui Gates

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Great product it was a little large for my needs however I will be buying their 3 and 5 gallon the quality of this product is great I moved a watered plant took two people and the handles didn’t break
customer_reviews.author: mellisa

customer_reviews.title: Happy Veggies
customer_reviews.text: Switched from plastic pots to these bags this season. Vegetable plants did very well with better water management. The handles are essential and the 98 cent clear plastic trays are essential.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Lagin

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, good construction
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use it but the constructions is good and strong. The size is fine for my intended use and I believe it will hold up well in Florida's summer temperatures. Too soon to tell for that but I might come back in a few months with an update.
customer_reviews.author: Pixie

customer_reviews.title: It  is what it is
customer_reviews.text: It's not far enough in the season to say yet. But one of the handles have already ripped on me. I have a very small backyard with limited sun so I move it around the yard a lot. I have a watermelon plant in one with a tomato cage to protect it from weed wackers . It seems to be doing its job.
customer_reviews.author: Susannah G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Durable
customer_reviews.text: These grow bags are a great garden addition. I used them for vegetables and they were easy to move and stood up very well under our hot Florida sun. The plants also grew and produced very well in them. I will be adding more with my next plantings.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Breathable tree containers
customer_reviews.text: These grow bag feels thick, and has 2 handles to carry my trees around. I was hoping the bags would be taller instead of wider. When I water the trees, excess water does leak out from the side. I am not sure if that is a good thing or not.
customer_reviews.author: Son Thuy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move
customer_reviews.text: Got Brussels Sprouts growing in two now. Three plants per bag. As plants get taller I roll up the sides and add more soil. Easy to move. Waiting to see how well they work as weather gets colder.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Moon Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great grow bags
customer_reviews.text: Great grow bags for people who feel the need to start a garden in a hurry, and they are so much less expensive than building raised beds.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie N

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order. The "pots" are just the right size for a tomato plant. The bag allows water to seep out rather than rotting the roots. The black fabric attacts heat which tomatoes love. My plants are thriving.
customer_reviews.author: VK Falls

customer_reviews.title: Just extra wide.
customer_reviews.text: The extra volume comes solely from extra width. I thought it would be a little wider and a little taller. Not sure this is going to work for what I had in mind.
customer_reviews.author: MacTownFun

customer_reviews.title: Couple handles ripped
customer_reviews.text: Couple handles ripped after putting dirt in (no water at that point) and plants in. Interesting bag, just not for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Jean LeBean

customer_reviews.title: great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday, and immediately got to planting my vegetables, these containers are huge, these were a great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Neshelle

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and quality
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be pretty good quality, Have not had them in the sun or cold to test if they would last outside. Inside they have to be in a tray, Water does leak through. Seem to be sown well, and of good quality material.
customer_reviews.author: cjj

customer_reviews.title: Great for excellent growth and manageability.
customer_reviews.text: These bags appear thick to last several years. The cut and sewing looks very accurate and done deliberately with quality in mind. Very good value. I have used other grow bags but these type of bags beats plastic grow bags and pots always.
customer_reviews.author: Joey C. Angus

customer_reviews.title: If your a beginner or advanced gardener these are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Can’t wait to get more! Very sturdy! Planted vegetables that normally take over my veggie garden so I can move the outside of it when they got big. So great!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Restaino

customer_reviews.title: Water leaks out sides
customer_reviews.text: While this may seem obvious, as fabric is porous, water leaks through. Somehow I didnt think about the fact that this means it leaks out the SIDES of the "pot" as well as the bottom, making a tray relatively useless. This concept, while well-intentioned, doesn't work well for houseplants. They offer a "one-year money back guarantee" yet Amazon returns doesn't seem to honor this and is giving me hassle about making returns. :(
customer_reviews.author: Heather S

customer_reviews.title: What Is this?
customer_reviews.text: My tomatoes are growing great, however what could this be? Mold? Calcium? Im getting nervous weather has been a bit cool for tomatoes,
customer_reviews.author: James Iacouzzi

customer_reviews.title: Replace your pots with these! You can’t go wrong
customer_reviews.text: These are durable and have withstood a lot of heat in the Texas sun. My plants are growing like crazy in them. I won’t use regular pots again for veggie container growing.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne M Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Very strong bags and quite affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I am trying grow bags for the first time. Time will tell how the veggies I planted do. But on first impression, these bags are sturdy and should last a long time. Very light weight material, but feels strong enough to hold the planting medium and plant. I got the 6-pack 10 gallon bags and I am growing eggplants, dwarf tomatoes and bell pepper in them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Joshi

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, scrunches/folds down for easy storage
customer_reviews.text: just planted, so I do not know about the durability yet... time will tell. I am also using one bag as a portable tote for gathering that which I weeded. For this reason, I wish the handles were a little longer; but I am mostly satisfied at this point.
customer_reviews.author: luedart

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. It's really too early to grade their durability. I do like them and time will tell all. They will hold 1.5 cubic yards of potting soil . Good information to know when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Allan W McCollum

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for patio tomato’s
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to try out for my tomato plants on my patio and could not be more pleased. They are way sturdier than I thought they would be and worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: SavannahD.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is performing exactly as expected. You shouldn’t try and fill the bag completely with a plant in it and then transport it somewhere; the felt/fabric handles can only handle so much. I got the 10-gallon bags and these are doing what I wanted: Give me better drainage in a pot while saving money. These perform as good as my 30$ whiskey barrels.
customer_reviews.author: DrMike27

customer_reviews.title: 10 gallon bag
customer_reviews.text: A little smaller than expected. Reordered 25 gallon bags. I will use the ten for other purposes though.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mazon

customer_reviews.title: Four Bags = 20+ lbs of Spuds
customer_reviews.text: What great bags. Potato production was perfect. Used Miracle Gro Garden Soil to keep the weight down. Got plant stalks 3' tall!
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Begonia

customer_reviews.title: Look/ work amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that these may look or perform cheaply.... but they really are very pretty, i planted some shade/ filler ornamental bushes in them.... then i realized i could move then around the yard as needed to shade and protect new seedlings i had started. The handles are so useful!
customer_reviews.author: tattootania

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pot
customer_reviews.text: Will definitely use again next year. Great pot. Have been a gardener for years. These are so easy to move around if needed and you can easily pick them up to see if they need water. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: nds

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I read previous reviews so I dont use the straps to move them in fear of them breaking. Size good for 1 tomato or 2 pepper plant. 1 has pepper and eggplant growing and both are thriving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of grow bags and the versatility they give me in the garden. This product and transaction is / was great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. This is my first time using a fabric container so I look forward to seeing how this product works. Its made of good fabric and the handles make it easy to move my veggies. Plan to use more of these pots for my vegetable growing.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are really good. Takes a 2 cubic foot bag of soil ...
customer_reviews.text: These are really good. Takes a 2 cubic foot bag of soil to fill. Holds the shape good and deep enough for root vegetables. This size is a little heavy to move, but not impossible, so that should be considered . I just planted so don't know how things will turn.out yet .
customer_reviews.author: Heather Cover

customer_reviews.title: 3 of 6 containers broke in the first day
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend these containers if you are using they for planting. They would make good reusable grocery bags. But, they are not sturdy enough to handle and actual plant. After filling all six of mine with dirt and adding plants: two of the handles tore off as soon as I tried to just shift the container. Another bag tore down a seam.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Nocchi

customer_reviews.title: Great product, size and price
customer_reviews.text: Great product, size and price. Work well with small square tomato cages. Material not as thick as some but nearly as expensive either. Should easily get two years use from the bags.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Fish

customer_reviews.title: wont hold water.
customer_reviews.text: These drain very well. holds the soil in and you can grow lots of things in them. stand up to lifting weight
customer_reviews.author: txump

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Had to move several plants in my backyard and was uncertain where to put them. The 'Grow Bar/Aeration Fabric Pots filled the bill. They were economical, well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: JiminNC

customer_reviews.title: The reusable and grow great plants
customer_reviews.text: I like the material and I like the fabric really well-made haven't used them yet but there going to be great!!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Handles seem little weak but so far so good. I haven’t had them going long
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy yet easy easy to move
customer_reviews.text: I planted my fall vegetables in them so I could move them in and out as the temperature falls. They are perfect. Plants looks great, easy to transport if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Lozier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Been outside since we got them and they haven't degreaded to weathered at all!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to plastic pots
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect product for my patio planter. Good quality at a good price. And can easily be moved.
customer_reviews.author: stanley j gawronski

customer_reviews.title: Second year and quite happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: May 2018. Second gardening season for these grow bags. Last year I grew potatoes and peppers in them, was pleased with the peppers and the potato plants, not so much the potato harvest. The bags were left outside, full of soil, over the New England winter. This spring they look like new, have kept the black color and shape and the material is as if brand new. In the garden I keep them on top of concrete pavers, not directly on top of soil or mulch. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: milena

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a year now and love them. So far have proved to be sturdy and so handy.
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: These bags are doing great, can drag/slide the bags around with the handles which are definitely strong enough to do the job as I move them outdoors on nice days and then drag back in on cold nights and days.
customer_reviews.author: Roger R

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: Fit in my large pot making it easier to bring in pot during the winter. Several neighbors have seen and purchased
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Cuccia

customer_reviews.title: Second type I've had...they work if you don't move them.
customer_reviews.text: These will work great if you don't need to move them while full.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Stockman

customer_reviews.title: Super for tomato’s, herbs, potato’s plants is what I tried
customer_reviews.text: I love growing my tomato plants in these! I got tomatoes growing and they are getting so big! I’m super happy! I got my herbs also in one of them too. And also I am still growing my potato Plants . When I harvest them I’ll let u all know ! Until then that’s all folks!
customer_reviews.author: JessM

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I like them alot but I am not ready to plant them yet
customer_reviews.author: Shellers

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: My sweet potatoes are taking off. This works well and is sturdy. I've had to move the plants a few times when they were completely filled with soil and the handles hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Negus

customer_reviews.title: Affordable but be careful of handles
customer_reviews.text: Best method for allowing roots of plants to breathe. The handles could be sturdier and attached with thicker seams, as I can see them breaking if handled roughly with a full bag of wet soil.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Not well made.
customer_reviews.text: Ripped when lifting, not as durable as similar product purchased last year from other seller. Those are still intact!!

customer_reviews.title: Check the sizes when you receive the delivery
customer_reviews.text: Received 4 of the same size and 2 of the 3gal not 2 of each as stated but needed to transplant my plants ASAP so didn’t have time to return and order another set. Quality seems to be in line with others I’ve purchases

customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! This is supposed to be a 6 pack of 10 gallon fabric pots! I only received 5 packs!

product_meta.title: WINNER OUTFITTERS 6-Pack 10 Gallon Grow Bags/Aeration Fabric Pots with Handles
feature_bullets: Material: Made with high quality nonwoven fabric, Built-in handles for easy movement
Structure: Prevents roots circling and air-prunes plant's root structure, so it's better than Plastic Containers
Warmer & Cooler: Keeps plant warmer in winter and cooler in the summer

Holiday Gift Choice for Christmas, We provide detailed instructions for use and maintenance procedures in the pictures and description, if there are other problems, we will reply you in the first time.
